Package com.arbibot.infra.adapter.forexchangecommunication.binance

Class BufferEvent<T>

java.lang.Object
com.arbibot.infra.adapter.forexchangecommunication.binance.BufferEvent<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of elements held in this buffer
public class BufferEvent<T> extends Object
A generic circular buffer implementation that supports a fixed size. Once the buffer reaches its capacity, the oldest element is removed and all elements are shifted.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors

    Description
    BufferEvent(int capacity)
    Constructs a CircularBuffer with the specified capacity.

  • Constructor Details

    • BufferEvent

      public BufferEvent(int capacity)
      Constructs a CircularBuffer with the specified capacity.
      Parameters:
      capacity - the maximum number of elements the buffer can hold

  • Method Details

    • add

      public void add(T item)
      Adds an element to the buffer. If the buffer is full, the oldest element is removed to make room for the new element.
      Parameters:
      item - the element to add

    • get

      public T get(int index)
      Retrieves the element at the specified index.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the element to retrieve
      Returns:
      the element at the specified index
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of range (index < 0 || index >= size)

    • getLast

      public <I extends T> List<I> getLast(int count, Class<I> cls)
      Retrieves the last x elements of type I from the buffer.
      Type Parameters:
      I - a type that extends T
      Parameters:
      count - the number of elements to retrieve
      cls - the class of type I
      Returns:
      a list of the last x elements of type I from the buffer

    • getSize

      public int getSize()
      Returns the current size of the buffer.
      Returns:
      the number of elements in the buffer

    • getCapacity

      public int getCapacity()
      Returns the capacity of the buffer.
      Returns:
      the maximum number of elements the buffer can hold

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Checks if the buffer is empty.
      Returns:
      true if the buffer contains no elements, false otherwise

    • isFull

      public boolean isFull()
      Checks if the buffer is full.
      Returns:
      true if the buffer is full, false otherwise
